intro: Leucanthemum vulgare var. autumnale, commonly known as the autumn oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow central disk surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers full sun to partial shade. It thrives in well-drained soil and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges. The flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, adding color to the landscape during the transition seasons.
